newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares end flat, NatSteel active.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares end flat, NatSteel active.

text.p: Singapore share market ended mostly flat in lacklustre trade on Tuesday except for a flurry of late buying in national steel company NatSteel Ltd after some brokerage houses upgraded the stock, dealers said.

"The talking point today is NatSteel which saw strong buying interest after several houses upgraded the stock. Two foreign houses were seen actively buying," a dealer said. NatSteel rose S$0.18 (US$0.13) at S$2.72 on volume of 2.8 million shares.
The key Straits Times Industrials Index ended 5.55 points off at 2,070.23. Turnover was moderately light at 93.4 million shares, with gainers leading losers by 159 to 142.
Dealers said there was also speculative buying in Indonesian-linked stocks like United Pulp Paper and Van Der Horst.
Labroy Marine, which ended at S$1.23, topped the actives with 4.75 million shares on rumours of buying by a prominant Malaysian party.

Creative Technology led losers, shedding S$0.70 to S$9.10 on profit-taking after Monday's gains. "Sentiment for the stock and the electronic sector has not really turned positive. It remains cautious," a dealer said.
